Description: Ostracon, large fragment of the shoulder section of a brown pottery ribbed vessel, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior, with base of one handle surviving, is covered with a self-slip and faint traces of one line of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394317) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394317)
